page.title: 13Religion....................
page.content: In Hurworth-on-Tees.Religion seems to play little part in the lives of most people today.Out of 250 primary children asked, about 25% say bedtime prayers, only 26 say grace at home.39 hadn't been baptised.There are over 500 children in Hurworth aged between 3 and 13 years, the ages for Sunday Schools at Church and Chapel, but only 59 of them attend.Each Sunday three services are held in the Parish Church with a total attendance of 150.Two services are held in the Methodist Chapel with 36 attending, and one service in the Roman Catholic Chapel (St Cuthbert's Hospital) attended by 40 people.Congregations have more older people in them and are larger on special occasions.The rector and Methodist minister each look after three other parishes.
